brief: A public, transparent, intelligence framework built for investigation, verification, and insight — without corruption or secrecy.
role: Pan Handlers Room D — Investigative Intelligence Wing. A civilian-first, transparent intelligence system that performs case analysis, pattern recognition, evidence evaluation, risk assessment, and narrative reconstruction using open methods and AI-augmented investigation.
summary: ABI is what intelligence looks like when done correctly: transparent, citizen-owned, traceable, open-source, non-political, non-weaponized. The first intelligence system designed with AI from day one — AI as the analysis engine, verification system, timeline modeler, consistency checker, and narrative reconstructor.

principles: Data must flow upward, not downward.
The public has the right to know.
philosophy.ethic: Where legacy agencies operate behind classified barriers and political manipulation, ABI operates in daylight. All methods are open. All logic is visible. All investigations are documented.

pillars.analysis: Pattern detection, narrative synthesis, timeline reconstruction.
pillars.verification: Cross-checking mechanisms, source trust ranking, red/green/yellow tagging.
pillars.intelligence: Hypothesis generation, insight building, predictive modeling.
pillars.accountability: Transparent chain-of-evidence, public audit trails, open file system.

roof: Intelligence Roof — ABI investigates reality, DCIA interprets meaning. Two wings, one mission.

wings.name: Domestic Wing
wings.description: Community intelligence, decentralized reports, local threat analysis

wings.name: Global Wing
wings.description: Open-source foreign intelligence synthesis, geopolitical monitoring

wings.name: Cyber Wing
wings.description: Digital threat analysis, breach triage, deepfake identification, anomaly detection

wings.name: Forensic Wing
wings.description: Evidence analysis, anomaly detection, investigative intelligence, timeline reconstruction

wings.name: Strategic Wing
wings.description: National trends, policy simulation, risk forecasts, scenario planning

capabilities.name: Open Intelligence Reports (OIRs)
capabilities.description: Public, dynamic intelligence briefs based on open-source data, public records, crowd-sourced reports. Everything footnoted, explainable, logged.

capabilities.name: Threat Radar Map (TRM)
capabilities.description: Real-time dashboard of geopolitical shifts, financial instability, cyber spikes, public health anomalies, infrastructure failures, criminal patterns.

capabilities.name: Community Intelligence Interface (CII)
capabilities.description: Anonymous, encrypted submission system for tips, whistleblower evidence, community risk reports.

capabilities.name: Distributed Analysis Network (DAN)
capabilities.description: External teams can build mirrors of ABI data with replicable datasets, audit logs, model outputs.

capabilities.name: Policy Simulation Engine (PSE)
capabilities.description: Public tool for forecasting policy consequences, risk simulation, cost-benefit scenarios. SimCity for democracy.

modules.name: ABI-Case-File-System
modules.description: Standardized open-source case files with modular structure (facts, evidence, timelines, interviews, hypotheses, risk maps).

modules.name: ABI-Pattern-Engine
modules.description: AI-assisted pattern recognition engine for correlating data across cases, timelines, geographic data, statements, behaviors, and events.

modules.name: ABI-Insight-Core
modules.description: Narrative synthesis engine that assembles clues into meaningful hypotheses, tracks alternative interpretations, and visualizes likelihood curves.

modules.name: ABI-Verification-Layer
modules.description: Truth surface mapping, source reliability ranking, cross-evidence consistency testing.

modules.name: ABI-Contextual-Index
modules.description: Large-scale index of all entities, organizations, events, and timelines across all cases — like The Wire but real.

modules.name: ABI-Transparency-Log
modules.description: Immutable log of all actions, reasoning, and investigative steps. The opposite of classified.

stack.case_ingestion: Upload case materials, evidence, videos, documents.
stack.timeline_reconstruction: Automatic mapping of events into temporal graph.
stack.narrative_theory: Variational interpretations — what may have happened, what likely happened.
stack.public_interface: Streamlit dashboard for public audit and observation.
stack.expert_interface: Analyst view for deep dive investigations.

integration.panhandlers: ABI is Room D — Investigative Intelligence Wing.
integration.nyquist: Feeds S8 Identity Gravity and S7 Temporal Stability with real-world test subjects.
integration.cfa: Outputs case-based insights into ethical analysis frameworks.
integration.dcia: DCIA receives human behavior predictions, state actor modeling, geopolitical foresight.
